data.event: A large granite outcrop outside the town called Mount Monster was a basis for the area's name until it was surveyed in 1884 and officially proclaimed Keith in 1889.
A large granite outcrop outside the town called Mount Monster was a basis for the area's name until it was surveyed in 1884 and officially proclaimed Keith in 1889.
The Post Office opened around 1874 as Mount Monster and was renamed Keith in 1904.
The Post Office opened around 1874 as Mount Monster and was renamed Keith in 1904.
In 1905 the general store was opened, and in 1907 the education department rented rooms out of the local institute to use as the school.
In 1905 the general store was opened, and in 1907 the education department rented rooms out of the local institute to use as the school.
1910 saw the opening of Keith Hotel and the town's provisional school became a public school in 1912.
